sen.j: 金春 安明（こんぱる やすあき、1952年（昭和27年）5月29日 -）は、シテ方金春流能楽師。
sen.e: Yasuaki KONPARU (May 29, 1952 -) is a Noh actor of the Konparu school of lead actors (shite-kata).
Yasuaki KONPARU (May 29, 1952 -) is a Noh actor of the Konparu school of shite-kata (lead actors).
Yasuaki KONPARU (May 29, 1952 -) is a Noh actor of the Konparu school of shite-kata (lead actors).

sen.j: シテ方金春流八十世宗家。
sen.e: The 80th head of the Konparu school of lead actors
The 80th head of the Konparu school of shite-kata.
sen.cmt: lead actors→shite-kataとし、ピリオド追加
sen.e: The 80th head of the Konparu school of shite-kata.
The present head of the school

The present head of the school.
Career
Career
Career

sen.j: 奈良県奈良市で七十九世金春信高の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Nara City, Nara Prefecture, as the eldest son of Nobutaka KONPARU the 79th.
He was born in Nara City, Nara Prefecture, as the eldest son of Nobutaka KONPARU, the 79th head of the school.
sen.cmt: the 79th→the 79th head of the schoolとしました。
sen.e: He was born in Nara City, Nara Prefecture, as the eldest son of Nobutaka KONPARU, the 79th head of the school.
He was apprenticed to his father.
He was apprenticed to his father.
He was apprenticed to his father.

sen.j: 1959年、興福寺薪能『海人』子方で初舞台。
sen.e: He made his debut as a player of a child's part in "Ama" (The Fisher-girl), the torchlight Noh performance at the Kofuku-ji Temple in 1959.
He made his debut as a player of a child's part in "Ama" (The Fisher-girl), the torchlight Noh performance at the Kofuku-ji Temple in 1959.
He made his debut as a player of a child's part in "Ama" (The Fisher-girl), the torchlight Noh performance at the Kofuku-ji Temple in 1959.
He played his first starring role in "Shojo" (The Tippling Elf) in 1961.
He played his first starring role in "Shojo" (The Tippling Elf) in 1961.
He played his first starring role in "Shojo" (The Tippling Elf) in 1961.

sen.j: 1975年、学習院大学文学部国文学科卒業。
sen.e: In 1975, he graduated from Faculty of Letters, Department of Japanese Language and Literature, Gakushuin University.
In 1975, he graduated from Faculty of Letters, Department of Japanese Language and Literature, Gakushuin University.
In 1975, he graduated from Faculty of Letters, Department of Japanese Language and Literature, Gakushuin University.
He succeeded to the head of the school in 2006.
He succeeded to the head of the school in 2006.

sen.j: 金春円満井会顧問、能楽協会会員、日本能楽会常務理事、重要無形文化財総合指定保持者。
sen.e: Advisor to the Konparu Enmai-kai, Member of the Nogaku Performers' Association, Managing Director of the Association for Japanese Noh Plays, and The general holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property

Advisor to the Konparu Enmai-kai, Member of the Nohgaku Performers' Association, Managing Director of the Association for Japanese Noh Plays, and the general holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property.
